NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS
119 GREGORY HALL
URBANA, ILLINOIS
Mr* Graydon Ausmus
Box 2002
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
December 9, 1953
Dear Graydon:
Thanks for your note about candidates for the associate director*s job*
I have written to most of the persons you mention, and as soon as we
get on top of the present load, I shall be distributing dittoed copies
of all letters so far received. I think we by now have some half dozen*
Che thing worries me a little. Mr. Bernstein, Sy Siegel*s candidate,
was under the impression that the job paid $9,000. If this were true
we would of course have to have $10,000 budgeted for us, in order to
cover retirement and workmen*s compensation. Che of the problems we
now have is that workmen*s compensation was not included in the present
budget, and, since this deduction goes to 2$ on January 1, another
nearly $1,000 deficiency will show up here in the present budget, to
add to the $1,000 over-draft inherited from last year and the $4,000
administrative charge made by the University for both last year and
this year, but deducted from this year*s budget.
If we receive $8,000, we shall be able to pay a maximum of $7,275* The
sums which we will have to pay, from our budget, will amount to 9*79$
of this sum, to bring the total we spend on this person to approximately
$8,000. I hope we are clear on what has been requested and what will be
secured. I would not be^adverse to receiving more myself, of course,
and I assume a promotion'"as high a salary as possible for an associate
director would be a good"'way to work toward this. I do have the im¬
pression that going rates may be somewhat higher than was budgeted either
for my job or the other one, but I hope that, unless or until new re¬
sources are available, any offer made will be in the realm of funds
allocated.
You will notice that we have put a special note, inviting applications,
in the December Newsletter on this. I hope to have all applications
distributed for consideration within the next couple of weeks.
Fulbright applications are now essentially all in. Would you care to
designate a committee to whom these might be referred?
